abstract.p: Hokkaido National Fisheries Research Institute (HNF) and Tohoku National Fisheries Research Institute (TNFRI) made a repeat hydrographic section across the Oyashio off the Hokkaido Island, Japan in 1987. Physical oceanographic observation started 1987 and chemical/biological measurement followed from 1990. Hydrographic observations have been operated 98-times almost bimonthly from January 1988 to Mar. 2003 along this section, which is called "A-line" after the name of the Akkeshi-town near the starting point of this line.

Observations are still ongoing, and monitoring parameter consists of CTD data from surface down to 3000m, bottle salinity, nutrients and Chlorophyll-a data from surface to 200m depth (or 3000m depth after 2002 except for Chlorophyll-a). Net-plankton biomass had also been observed with various gears, and various other biogeochemical parameters such as DIC, alkalinity, POC/N, DOC/N, iron concentrations, biogenic silica, phytoplankton/zooplankton species composition, microzooplankton, bacteria abundance, water optical properties, and primary production are also measured along A-line at certain period in collaboration with other institutes and universities.

descript.purpose: To understand the mechanism of spatio-temporal variabilities of physical/biogeochemical environment in the Oyashio region.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
